Package ui

Class Label

java.lang.Object
ui.Component
ui.ColouredComponent
ui.Label
All Implemented Interfaces:
EngineComponent
public class Label
extends ColouredComponent
The Label class is used to display a single line of text on the game screen

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected Text text
    The Text instance to be displayed

    Fields inherited from class ui.ColouredComponent

    color

    Fields inherited from class ui.Component

    gameInstance, height, width, x, y

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Label​(SnakeGame g, double X, double Y, Text t)
    Construct a new instance of the Label class, setting the width and height of the underlying Component to 0 as they're dynamically generated based on the width and height of the text.
    Label​(SnakeGame g, Text t)
    Construct a new instance of the Label class, setting the width and height of the underlying Component to 0 as they're dynamically generated based on the width and height of the text.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Label center​(boolean horizontal, boolean vertical, int xOffset, int yOffset)
    A proxy method of Component::center used to avoid having to cast Component to Label every time.
    double getHeight()
    Fetches the effective height of the Label class by finding the rendered height of the underlying Text

    Returns the underlying Text instance that this Label intends to display.

  • Field Details

    • text

      protected Text text
      The Text instance to be displayed

  • Constructor Details

    • Label

      public Label​(SnakeGame g, double X, double Y, Text t)
      Construct a new instance of the Label class, setting the width and height of the underlying Component to 0 as they're dynamically generated based on the width and height of the text.
      Parameters:
      g - The SnakeGame instance this Label belongs to
      X - The X position of the Label
      Y - The Y position of the Label
      t - The text to display

    • Label

      public Label​(SnakeGame g, Text t)
      Construct a new instance of the Label class, setting the width and height of the underlying Component to 0 as they're dynamically generated based on the width and height of the text. Also, sets the X and Y position to 0 for setting later (potentially via Label::center().
      Parameters:
      g - The SnakeGame instance this Label belongs to
      t - The text to display
      See Also:
      center(boolean, boolean, int, int)

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update​(double dt)
      Fired each update tick; this component requires no updates so this method is ignored
      Parameters:
      dt - Time passed since last update

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent()
      Draws this label to the screen

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()
      Fetches the effective width of the Label class by finding the rendered width of the underlying Text
      Overrides:
      getWidth in class Component
      Returns:
      Returns the width of the Label

    • getHeight

      public double getHeight()
      Fetches the effective height of the Label class by finding the rendered height of the underlying Text
      Overrides:
      getHeight in class Component

      Returns the height of the Label

    • getText

      public Text getText()
      Returns the underlying Text instance that this Label intends to display.
      Returns:
      Returns the Text instance

    • center

      public Label center​(boolean horizontal, boolean vertical, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      A proxy method of Component::center used to avoid having to cast Component to Label every time. Using Generics would invalidate the type-safe nature of the class hierarchy, so this approach was used instead. Centers the text via the methods enabled. Will center horizontally only if horizontal param is true. Likewise with vertical. The xOffset and yOffset will be applied to the X and Y position after centering has completed.
      Overrides:
      center in class Component
      Parameters:
      horizontal - If true, centers the component horizontally
      vertical - If true, centers the component vertically
      xOffset - The offset applied to the X position
      yOffset - The offset applied to the Y position
      Returns:
      Returns the Label instance, to enable method chaining
